breakingNews: NFP: Non-farm Payrolls prints at +428k v/s +391k expected, Unemployment at 5.6% v/s 5.5%

topNews.title: NFP: Non-farm Payrolls Prints at +428k v/s +391k Forecast, Unemployment at 3.6%
topNews.description: It's been a busy week but the calendar isn't finished yet, as we look at this morning's NFP release ahead of a number of Fed speakers on the calendar for later today.

authors.name: James Stanley
authors.title: Senior Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2010</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental </li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Term (2 Days to 2 Weeks) </li> <li>Type: Event-Driven </li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started working with equities in 1999, options in 2000 and FX in 2009</li> <li>Worked at Merrill Lynch, Fidelity and TD Ameritrade</li> <li>Frequent contributor to ZeroHedge.com</li> <li>Has spoken at numerous trader expos and conferences over the years</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor of Business Administration degree in Financial Services and Planning from Baylor University’s Hankamer School of Business</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“If you don’t manage your risk, it will manage you. Without a good defense, your offense doesn’t matter. And – hope is a terrible trading strategy.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2010. Experience: Started working with equities in 1999, options in 2000 and FX in 2009. Worked at Merrill Lynch, Fidelity and TD Ameritrade. Frequent contributor to ZeroHedge.com. Has spoken at numerous trader expos and conferences over the years.

topNews.title: Live Data Coverage: April US NFP & Unemployment Rate
topNews.description: Consensus forecasts are looking for jobs growth of +391K while the unemployment rate (U3) is anticipated to drop to 3.5% from 3.6%.
topNews.newsKeywords: live data coverage, us nfp, us nonfarm payrolls, nonfarm payrolls, us jobs, us jobs report, us labor market, biden stimulus, fed taper, fed rate, fed hike, fed qt

authors.name: Christopher Vecchio, CFA
authors.title: Senior Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2008</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental</li> <li>Time Frame: Long-Term (2 weeks to 6 months)</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <p><a href=""/research/dna-fx"">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started trading in equities in 2004 and FX in 2008</li> <li>Has worked with DailyFX since attending college in 2008 starting with an internship</li> <li>Has consulted multi-national firms on FX hedging and has lectured at Duke Law School on FX derivatives trading</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>B.A. in Economics & B.A. in Political Science from Lafayette College</li> <li>CFA charterholder as of August 2017</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“Trading is about taking decisive action, but you need to be divorced from your emotions. Getting married to a position in the market is a result of many cognitive biases interfering with a sound trading and investment strategy. It’s important to remain objective and be willing to admit defeat as soon as the evidence accumulates against your favor. It’s better to take a small loss and admit you were wrong than take a big loss because you insisted that you were right.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2008. Experience: Started trading in equities in 2004 and FX in 2008. Has worked with DailyFX since attending college in 2008 starting with an internship. Has consulted multi-national firms on FX hedging and has lectured at Duke Law School on FX derivatives trading.

topNews.title: Euro Forecast: ECB Hawks Out in Force, EUR/GBP Breakout Ahead of NFP
topNews.description: Euro sees modest recovery as ECB hawks come out in force. EUR/GBP breakout.

authors.name: Justin McQueen
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2018</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: More Fundamental</li> <li>Time Frame: Long-Term (Over 2 Weeks)</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started as an analyst servicing intra-day proprietary traders via a squawk service in 2014, covering the Asian, US and European markets. </li> <li>Has worked with DailyFX since 2018 as market analyst</li> <li>Has spoken at several investor / client conferences since joining DailyFX</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business Economics at Nottingham Business School</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“Markets can remain irrational longer than you can remain solvent”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2018. Experience: Started as an analyst servicing intra-day proprietary traders via a squawk service in 2014, covering the Asian, US and European markets. Has worked with DailyFX since 2018 as market analyst. Has spoken at several investor / client conferences since joining DailyFX.

asia.title: Euro Leaps as British Pound Sinks and Rate Hikes Rattle Markets. Where to For EUR/GBP?
asia.description: The Euro managed to avoid a rout as the US Dollar took flight on Fed hawkishness that pummelled Sterling. Will EUR/GBP continue to make new highs?
asia.newsKeywords: EURO, EUR/GBP, British Pound, US Dollar, Crude Oil, Fed, BoE, USD/CNY

authors.name: Daniel McCarthy
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2021</h2> <h2><strong>Trading Style</h2></strong> <ul> <li>Analytical Style: Macro inter-market, fundamental and technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Long Term</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Experience</h2></strong> <ul> <li>Commercial Bank FX price maker to clients and the inter-bank market</li> <li>Portfolio Manager handling currency exposure of Australia’s largest fund manager developing currency overlay programs</li> <li>Portfolio Manager with the Global Government Bond Fund</li> <li>Managed private capital using various strategies across equities, FX, commodities and rates</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</h2></strong> <p>Master of Business in Finance, University of Technology, Sydney</p> <p>Certificate IV in Training and Assessment</p> <h2><strong>Most Important trading Lesson Learned</h2></strong> <p>Plan the trade, then trade the plan. Always.</p>

us.title: US Dollar Price Action Setups: EUR/USD, GBP/USD, AUD/USD, USD/JPY

authors.name: Paul Robinson
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2016</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: More Technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Term (2 Days to 2 Weeks)</li> <li>Type: Swing</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>20 years of experience in trading and analysis in equities, futures, options, and FX</li> <li>Worked over a decade as a proprietary trader for Schonfeld, JGM Securities, and Torus Capital LLC, operating in several markets – equities/options, futures, interest rates, and FX. Worked at FXCM for 5 years in various analytical and trading roles.</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“You could have the most insightful analysis and robust trading strategies, but if your mind isn’t ‘right’, then none of it will matter. With time I learned the importance of spending a significant portion of my time on the mental game and less on the ‘fun stuff’, like analyzing data and charts.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2016. Experience: 20 years of experience in trading and analysis in equities, futures, options, and FX. Worked at FXCM for 5 years in various analytical and trading roles.

authors.descriptionLong: The DailyFX research team is composed of experts in the forex and commodities markets. The DailyFX research team provides the latest foreign exchange and commodity news and analysis.

specialReport.title: Trend Trading | The Trend is Your Friend
specialReport.description: In this video you will learn about how a basic trendline and other technical indicators included in most charting packages can be useful for the purpose of determining the direction of the trend and how using multiple time frames, traders can determine the longer trend and then zero in on the most recent price action.

authors.name: Tammy Da Costa
authors.title: Analyst
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2019</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: More Technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Short Term (Up to 2 Days)</li> <li>Type: Swing</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started trading in 2008 as part of an Investment Challenge</li> <li>Has worked in the Financial sector since 2013 for banks such as Investec and FNB</li> <li>Joined IG in 2016 as a sales trader and progressed to move to DailyFX in 2019 as a market writer</li> </ul>  <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Economics and Econometrics</li> </ul>  <h2><strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“There is a fine line between confidence and arrogance and in trading, it is essential to know when that line is being crossed. Regardless of the amount of trading experience one has, risk management is always crucial to any trading strategy.”</p>

specialReport.title: Markets DailyFX Analysts Are Most Interested In
specialReport.description: DailyFX analysts give their expert predictions and their 2022 Q2 forecasts to help you with your trading strategy and analysis, minimizing risk and maximizing returns. Predictions our analysts offer are based on fundamental factors such as economic outlook, capital flows and trade balances, or technical indicators such as moving averages and MACD.
